result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Merritt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-sentence Investigation prepared in Sawyer County will be updated and used for sentencing purposes in this case.
Case settlement

Defendant Chad M Merritt in court with attorney Matthew James Krische.  Defendant Chad M Merritt in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case settlement reached in this matter.  Court instructs on Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct's 1,2,4,10,11,14,19. The court will accept the plea's and find the DE guilty.  The balance of the counts will be dismissed but read in for sentencing/restitution purposes.  DE will pay restitution of $6200.71 J/S with co-defendants.  A PSI will be ordered. Set for sentencing after completion of PSI.  Atty Krische addresses the court as to an existing PSI prepared in Sawyer County.  The current PSI will be updated and used in this case for sentencing.
